sigma 28 40 lens.title: Sigma 28-105mm f/2.8 Lens Review: Funky & Flawless
sigma 28 40 lens.description: Review of Sigma's 28-105mm f/2.8 DG DN Art lens for Sony and Lumix. Discussing features, focusing, and image quality.

bump was rare and nowadays as mentioned it's just straight up unheard of video recording at 4K 30 isn't so great the image stabilization feels very janky to me unnatural and I can see the age here still overall I was impressed by the photography of the first Google pixel and it's not hard to see how they quickly fostered a reputation of having some of the best cameras in the smartphone industry now I did mention earlier that AI is now the focus of basically every new product coming out these days but this was actually also the case with the first Google pixel as this was in fact the first device to feature the Google assistant in many ways the first Google pixel is the quintessential pix pixel phone the design is bold and stands out the software is clean and fresh the photography is sharp and focused but the phone isn't perfect by any means the white thick bezels have aged terribly and not even having dual front firing speakers just feels like a waste lacking basic features like water resistance wasn't a good look in 2016 and there was absolutely room for improvement with future pixel models and ultimately the phone didn't end up selling anywhere near the numbers of Samsung or Apple the 2016 iPhone 7 and 7 plus saw around 160 million units sold throughout their lifespan the 2016 Galaxy S7 and S7 Edge saw around 55 million units sold and the first pixel and pixel XL sold over just 3 million the reality was and always has been Google hasn't seen the levels of success they would like to 2023 saw 10 million pixels sold so they've gotten better no doubt in part thanks to having more options throughout their lineup but there's also a lack of true dominance something their Nexus line also often struggled with still I think this was a fantastic start for Google's new smartphone line moving forward and in in my opinion the phone has aged about as well as any Android Flag ship from 2016 possibly can you've got to respect Google's determination having just gotten to their ninth pixel Flagship and only time will tell how many more phones will bear the pixel name and so with that I think I'm right about done here I didn't have a ton to say about this phone I do really like it especially that blue color if I'm being honest did any of you ever have this phone or consider getting it how do you think it's held up 8 years later make sure you leave your comments down below and if you found this video interesting please hit that like button and consider subscribing for more content just like like this huge shout out to the channel members for being absolutely amazing people and thank you all so much for watching I'm Josh from 91 Tech and I will see you all next time [Music] [Music]
